inclusion.criterion: Adult patients (at least 18 years old) with confirmed acromegaly
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: are persistently but modestly (1.0 ULN < [IGF-1 serum level] < 1.5 ULN) elevated following medical therapy such as SSA, PEGV, cabergoline alone or in combination.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The patient is a 41-year-old man and a known case of Acromegaly who underwent transsphenoidal surgery 4 months ago.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Progressive or recent visual field loss or optic chiasmal compression, or pituitary tumors within 2mm from the chiasm.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Cranial nerve palsies or intracranial hypertension requiring tumour decompression surgery
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has a history of acromegaly due to pituitary adenoma and recent surgery. He takes only vitamin D and multivitamins.
